Reaching a resolution with the bondholder group is a positive development to move forward with our plan of reorganization,
This agreement helps achieve our goals of fairly compensating wildfire victims, protecting customers’ bills and emerging from Chapter 11.

Investor groups have hijacked the bankruptcy process to ensure that they reap billions more in profits while individual fire victims receive cents on the dollar, are paid in installments, and have their recoveries funded in large part by stock in the restructured PG&E,

quotes.quote: The Room Where It Happened,
It’s a totally upside-down world,
history of warmongering

always gave the president the unvarnished truth,

I do not recall ever hearing people complain that he made up stuff.
I think Bolton has a lot of credibility,
Not just among the Republicans but our side as well.
I would say that he’s a witness very interested in making a lot of money right now,

one of my closest friends

quotes.quote: He was fired by the president,

a straight shooter, he’s an honest man, he’s an honorable man.

As architects, we are concerned with human comfort, so we set out to create a kind of atmosphere that would promote well-being,
Before, these projects were all just about keeping the weather out,

Engineers would be told, ‘This is the weather, this is the wind speed, these are the restrictions.’ But now these projects are about using architecture as a means of improving both well-being and operational efficiency.
how the approach to these projects has changed so dramatically in such a short period of time.

articles.title: 100 Years Ago, the Booziest January Suddenly Dried Up
articles.author: By Jennifer Harlan
articles.abstract: In 1920, Prohibition went into effect, but America partied on.

quotes.quote: manufacture, sale or transportation of intoxicating liquors
quotes.context: On Jan. 16, 1919 — more than a year before women could vote nationwide — the teetotalers achieved their ultimate goal: The Eighteenth Amendment, prohibiting the “manufacture, sale or transportation of intoxicating liquors” anywhere within the United States, was ratified.

quotes.quote: Nobody believed it would happen,

Prohibition was a small-town, rural movement, and people in the cities resented it. They really thought until the very end that there was going to be a way out of it, and then, suddenly, it became clear there wasn’t.
Every big cafe in New York City was having a party,
There were so many corks popping, it sounded like artillery fire.
just made you sad,
quotes.context: There were a few successes — one boozeless cocktail created during Prohibition is known today in its spiked form as the Bloody Mary — but for the most part, the concoctions were disappointing facsimiles that “just made you sad,” Mr. Wondrich said.

quotes.quote: Just trying to mimic spirits and classic cocktails is a recipe for failure,
There were breweries on the West Side of Manhattan making 200,000 gallons of beer a week,
The scale of industry was so insane that the law became a joke.

On every face was stamped that extraordinary and inexplicable expression of triumph mingled with apprehension which the possession of an irreplaceable treasure in a predicament of extraordinary peril is wont to imbue.
Last Call: The Rise and Fall of Prohibition.
Mary Pickford’s mom bought the contents of an entire liquor store.
It’s that notion of doing something that’s against the law but not evil,
There’s fun in defying authority.
consider what a negroni feels like,
quotes.context: Instead of trying to replicate the specific flavor of a negroni, you should “consider what a negroni feels like,” she added.

quotes.quote: It’s that tension between salty and sour and sweet and bitter that pleases the human palate,

And that experience can be delivered without alcohol, with the same level of complexity, but you have to put a lot of labor into it. Basically, if you want to get something that’s not just a tiki-derivative sugar bomb, you’re going to have to cook.

articles.title: Prosecutor Sues Her Own City Under a Law Passed to Fight the K.K.K.
articles.author: By Richard A. Oppel Jr.
articles.abstract: Kimberly Gardner, the top prosecutor in St. Louis, who is under investigation herself, is accusing city officials of a “racially motivated conspiracy” to stop her from doing her job.

quotes.quote: racially motivated conspiracy

quotes.context: Kimberly Gardner, the St. Louis circuit attorney, accused city officials, the local police union and a special prosecutor of a “racially motivated conspiracy to deny the civil rights of racial minorities” by interfering with her efforts to to crack down on police misconduct and to institute changes in the city’s criminal justice system.

quotes.quote: frivolous, desperate and pathetic
quotes.context: The targets of her suit, filed on Monday in Federal District Court in St. Louis, sharply denied the accusations, with the police union calling the legal action “frivolous, desperate and pathetic” and characterizing the decision to file it as “the last act of a desperate woman” who is herself under investigation by the special prosecutor.

quotes.quote: the last act of a desperate woman

quotes.quote: We’re not going to let fear and injustice stop the reforms that are needed,
This is also about the continuing attacks on progressive prosecutors, not just in St. Louis, but around this country.

The keepers of the status quo that brought us mass incarceration, the over-criminalization of poor black and brown people, tough sentences, no redemption and no second chances won’t give up their power quietly,
It’s a pretty high bar to clear.
by force or by choice.
quotes.context: The business manager of the local police union, Jeff Roorda, has called for Ms. Gardner’s indictment, and he recently went on a radio show to suggest that she be removed from office “by force or by choice.”

quotes.quote: The city of St. Louis vehemently denies what it considers to be meritless allegations levied against it by Circuit Attorney Kim Gardner. The city fully expects to be vindicated.

We have always made our own decisions in Australia.
meet and beat

We are laggards,

and everyone, including Australia, needs to do an awful lot more than we are doing.

quotes.quote: And in doing so,
has allowed vital border wall construction to move forward using military construction funds.
quotes.context: “And in doing so,” the statement said, the court “has allowed vital border wall construction to move forward using military construction funds.”

quotes.quote: This wall will have no effect besides that they will destroy vegetation and habitat and while it’s standing it will cause flooding,
They couldn’t prove a single claim in court,
It was embarrassing!
quotes.context: “It was embarrassing!”

quotes.quote: a victory for the rule of law
quotes.context: In a statement on Thursday, the White House applauded as “a victory for the rule of law” the appeals court ruling in New Orleans that lifted an “illegitimate nationwide injunction.”

articles.title: California, Mired in a Housing Crisis, Rejects an Effort to Ease It
articles.author: By Conor Dougherty
articles.abstract: A lawmaker’s push for denser development near transit, overriding local zoning, was thwarted by a diverse group of legislative foes.

quotes.quote: This is about Californians who are hurting right now, and we have an obligation to represent them,
The only thing that folks agree on is that we need housing,
How we get there, everyone has a different theory.
Nothing in this bill is giving us more say; it’s taking away what little say we have now,

I’m not against development. I am just for communities navigating that development with a developer. We have community plans in South Los Angeles that we’ve been working on for 30 years that included a lot of input from a community that has historically been underrepresented in urban planning, and I think that’s important to protect.
The status quo cannot stand,
A housing production bill will succeed this year.
Marshall Plan for Housing,

articles.title: Warren Buffett Will Sell His Newspaper Empire
articles.author: By Michael J. de la Merced
articles.abstract: With a deal to sell Berkshire Hathaway’s newspapers to Lee Enterprises, the billionaire is giving up on the news business.

quotes.quote: We had zero interest in selling the group to anyone else for one simple reason: We believe that Lee is best positioned to manage through the industry’s challenges,

articles.title: The Titans Slew a Giant. Can They Take Down Another?
articles.author: By Benjamin Hoffman
articles.abstract: Tennessee’s combination of power running and a few deep passes does not look particularly modern — but it just might give the Baltimore Ravens a taste of their own medicine.

quotes.quote: When you can run it when the other team knows you’re going to run it, that says a lot about your running game,
It just felt like now was the time.
go in their favor.
quotes.context: Tannehill struggled against New England’s otherworldly secondary last week, and was largely written off as a nonfactor this week by Baltimore safety Earl Thomas, who said the Ravens were mostly preparing for Henry, since trying to pass the ball wouldn’t “go in their favor.”

articles.title: Mad at the Voter Who Left Jeter Off the Ballot? He’s Not
articles.author: By David Waldstein
articles.abstract: Jeter fell one anonymous vote short of being unanimously elected into the Hall of Fame, but he said he would “focus on the ones who did” name him.

quotes.quote: focus on the ones who did
quotes.context: Jeter fell one anonymous vote short of being unanimously elected into the Hall of Fame, but he said he would “focus on the ones who did” name him.

quotes.quote: I focus on the ones who did,
It takes a lot of people to all agree to get you to this point. So, I’m not thinking about that.
Yes, we are,
I don’t care where they put me. They can put me in the rest room.
I’m most proud that I was a Yankee,
It was the only thing I ever wanted to do as long as I could remember, to play shortstop for the New York Yankees. When it’s all said and done, that’s what I’m most proud of.
That’s the option each voter has.
It’s an honor just to be in the Hall of Fame,
I spent 10 years in Colorado,
where the majority of my damage was done.
quotes.context: “I spent 10 years in Colorado,” he said, “where the majority of my damage was done.”

articles.title: D.N.C. Rules Change for Nevada Debate Could Open Door for Bloomberg
articles.author: By Reid J. Epstein and Matt Stevens
articles.abstract: In a major shift, the Democratic National Committee will eliminate the requirement that candidates to show evidence of grass-roots support.

quotes.quote: We are thrilled that voters could soon have the chance to see Mike Bloomberg on the debate stage, hear his vision for the country, and see why he is the strongest candidate to defeat Donald Trump and bring our country together,

Mike has run for office three times and never taken a dime from special interests, allowing him to act independently, on the merits, without having to do what donors expect. He is proud to be doing the same with this campaign.
To now change the rules in the middle of the game to accommodate Mike Bloomberg, who is trying to buy his way into the Democratic nomination, is wrong,
That’s the definition of a rigged system.
The DNC didn’t change the rules to ensure good, diverse candidates could remain on the debate stage. They shouldn’t change the rules to let a billionaire on,
Billionaires shouldn’t be allowed to play by different rules — on the debate stage, in our democracy, or in our government.
When the initial rules came out with a focus on grass-roots fund-raising, of course our campaign was focused on the same thing,
Now it sounds like there is a different focus and I do believe that we will qualify.

Our logic for having a grass-roots fund-raising threshold was, it provides opportunity for people who don’t have the national name I.D. to get on the debate stage. If you want to win the presidency, you’ve got to connect with grass-roots America.
It’s a mistake for @TheDemocrats to change the rules for debates in the middle of this race to yield to a billionaire,
We need to respect the grass roots movement leading this party forward.
Changing the rules now to accommodate Mike Bloomberg and not changing them in the past to ensure a more diverse debate stage is just plain wrong,
They are changing the rules for a candidate who is ignoring early states’ voters and grass roots donors.

articles.title: Canada Offers Compensation to Families of Victims of Plane Downed in Iran
articles.author: By Ian Austen
articles.abstract: Prime Minister Justin Trudeau said that the payments to Canadian families of victims do not absolve Iran from providing compensation.

quotes.quote: I want to be clear: we expect Iran to compensate these families,
But I have met them, they can’t wait weeks. They need support now.

articles.title: His Mother Worked to Find Him Love Despite War, Blindness and Loss
articles.author: By Mujib Mashal
articles.abstract: The war in Afghanistan has taken so much from the poet Zaheer Ahmad Zindani. His mother was determined to ensure it wouldn’t take his chance to marry.

quotes.quote: Make it so no matter which of the four directions I comb, it looks good,
They would all say, ‘We would happily agree if he hadn’t been blind,’
quotes.context: “They would all say, ‘We would happily agree if he hadn’t been blind,’”

quotes.quote: My mother would say, ‘His eyes will be fixed.’ They would say, ‘Come back when they are fixed.’
quotes.context: “My mother would say, ‘His eyes will be fixed.’

quotes.quote: They wanted to make sure I would be nice to their daughter, that I would respect her rights, that I wouldn’t be abusive,
Both my mother and I told them since I am disabled and they are being generous with me, I will treat her as my crown.
Love with open eyes — when you have fallen in love with someone you have seen — is different with that of closed eyes,
When you can’t see the person, the thirst is not fulfilled the same.
the kind between the Prophet Muhammad and his wife Khadija.
quotes.context: The ceremony ended in about an hour, with a prayer by a local imam who wished the newlyweds eternal love — “the kind between the Prophet Muhammad and his wife Khadija.”

quotes.quote: I wish I could see it,
But my heart is happy.
This was my first real happiness in life,
They said the nerve-endings in the eyes are finished,

articles.title: Senators will not be able to speak during the trial.
articles.author: By Michael D. Shear
articles.abstract: No matter how strongly they feel about their motions, there will be no fist-pounding or stirring speeches. At least not from the senators themselves.

articles.title: Australia’s Wild Weather: First Fires, Now Baseball-Size Hail
articles.author: By Jamie Tarabay
articles.abstract: Severe heat and dry skies have given way to strong thunderstorms in the country’s southeast, where giant hailstones destroyed cars.

articles.title: No Charges in Assault Complaint at V.A. Hospital, and a Public Fight Erupts
articles.author: By Jennifer Steinhauer
articles.abstract: A cabinet secretary, a House committee chairman and an inspector general are at odds after a congressional staff member said she was sexually assaulted.

quotes.quote: you look like you could use a good time,
quotes.context: Ms. Goldstein, who works on the sexual assault issue for the committee, said a man slammed his body against hers below the waist and told her that “you look like you could use a good time,” Ms. Goldstein said in an interview.

quotes.quote: He pressed his entire body against mine,

We believe that V.A. is a safe place for all veterans to enter and receive care and services, but the unsubstantiated claims raised by you and your staff could deter our veterans from seeking the care they need and deserve,
shockingly tone-deaf
quotes.context: Mr. Takano, in his own response, called Mr. Wilkie’s letter “shockingly tone-deaf” and “outrageous.”

quotes.quote: When my staffer bravely came forward in September, she did so in the spirit of wanting other women veterans to feel safe,

But the secretary’s flippant letter is only further evidence to my staffer and others that coming forward is punished, speaking out retaliated against, and that a hostile culture at V.A. is tolerated.
Neither I nor my staff told you or anyone else at the department that the allegations were unsubstantiated,
Reaching a decision to close the investigation with no criminal charges does not mean that the underlying allegation is unsubstantiated.

articles.title: Covering Harvey Weinstein
articles.author: By Michael Barbaro
articles.abstract: An investigation that began in the pages of The Times becomes a criminal case in a courtroom.

quotes.quote: will have to answer to the American people,
quotes.context: Gen. Qassim Suleimani: What the administration “will have to answer to the American people,” she tells us, “is whether or not this assassination was worth it.”

quotes.quote: is whether or not this assassination was worth it.
quotes.context: Gen. Qassim Suleimani: What the administration “will have to answer to the American people,” she tells us, “is whether or not this assassination was worth it.”

quotes.quote: What we’ve seen is that the U.S. has effectively turned General Suleimani into a martyr.

articles.title: Catch up on the key moments from Thursday.
articles.author: By The New York Times
articles.abstract: Watch the highlights.

articles.title: New E.U. Trade Chief on a Quest to Fix Relations With the U.S.
articles.author: By Jack Ewing
articles.abstract: Some people think Phil Hogan’s blunt style will be an advantage in dealing with the Trump White House. He is making his first official trip to Washington this week.

quotes.quote: The current state of E.U.-U.S. relations isn’t good, and I don’t think it’s likely to get better anytime soon,
He is more direct,
He is probably the right person for this moment,
Phil knew every candidate, he knew every constituency,
Politics is about personal relationships, and Phil understands that,
He’s a very, very good negotiator,
Well, then, there isn’t any point in having agreements.
We have asked the U.S. to engage with us, and they have refused to do so,
When sides take unilateral actions that harm the other side, that are inconsistent with international norms, the other side has a right to be angry,
That’s where we are with the E.U. now.
I don’t think either side wants this to go back into a deep hole again and spiral into negativity,
Both sides want to kick off in a positive way.

articles.title: Marianne Williamson Drops Out of 2020 Race
articles.author: By Maggie Astor
articles.abstract: Ms. Williamson, a self-help author and spiritual adviser who ran for president, had viral debate moments but drew fire for her comments on science and medicine.

quotes.quote: I stayed in the race to take advantage of every possible opportunity to share our message,
With caucuses and primaries now about to begin, however, we will not be able to garner enough votes in the election to elevate our conversation any more than it is now.
get in the way of a progressive candidate winning
quotes.context: She added that, in a race as tight as this one, she did not want to “get in the way of a progressive candidate winning” any caucus or primary.

quotes.quote: Mr. President, if you’re listening, I want you to hear me, please: You have harnessed fear for political purposes, and only love can cast that out,
I’m going to harness love for political purposes. I will meet you on that field, and sir, love will win.
payment of a debt that is owed,
quotes.context: At that July debate, she gave forceful responses to two questions about race — describing reparations not as “financial assistance” but rather “payment of a debt that is owed,” and saying the water crisis in Flint, Mich., would never have happened in a wealthy, majority-white suburb — and got a brief surge of public attention.

quotes.quote: I will be there with all my energy and in full support.
Things are changing swiftly and dramatically in this country, and I have faith that something is awakening among us,
A politics of conscience is still yet possible. And yes … love will prevail.

articles.title: With Impeachment in the News, Ads Are Staying Away From Politics
articles.author: By Tiffany Hsu
articles.abstract: A desire not to offend potential customers in a divided nation, as well as wariness of President Trump’s Twitter account, means fewer topical ads.

quotes.quote: The West Wing
quotes.context: A Chrysler commercial starred a pair of actors known for their portrayals of fictional White House occupants: Martin Sheen (President Jed Bartlet of “The West Wing”) and Bill Pullman (President Thomas Whitmore of “Independence Day”).

quotes.quote: If we build a wall on the border, who will eat our delicious fish tacos?
Nike is getting absolutely killed with anger and boycotts.
more scary than exciting,
quotes.context: The environment for advertising is “more scary than exciting,” said Ellis Verdi, the president of DeVito/Verdi, the agency that created the Legal Sea Foods ad, and most companies no longer see an upside in weighing in on politics, even jokingly.

quotes.quote: There’s fear, as opposed to the entertainment that was associated with the horse race a couple of years ago,
Even free expression is a challenge right now. People are holding their hands over their eyes and ears a little bit. This is not the moment for advertisers to take risks.
It just feels wrong right now,
It’s like McCarthyism — people are too frickin’ scared to say anything,
It’s a divided world that we live in,
Can you afford to exclude half of your audience?
Trump has been in America’s 24-hour news cycle for the past four years: countless hours of ‘Saturday Night Live’ skits, tweets, memes, #resistance microsites, etc.,
People have simply had enough — enough outrage, enough disdain, enough shock value to the point where making a statement feels a little tired.
This notion that you pick on a president and then he tweets about you and is mean to your company is a new thing,
If you happen to be a large technology brand like Microsoft, and the government is your biggest client, then the last thing you need is to be in conflict with the White House.
being the pro-impeachment enterprise is not going to be good for business.
quotes.context: If that happens, he said, “being the pro-impeachment enterprise is not going to be good for business.”

articles.title: Will Canadians Have to Pay the Security Costs for Harry and Meghan?
articles.author: By Dan Bilefsky
articles.abstract: Some in Canada worry that the Duke and Duchess of Sussex could be expensive to protect.

quotes.quote: People who care about the monarchy and celebrity will view this in a good light,
Now the question will be who is going to pay the tab for the security bill.
At the moment, the royal family don’t live here or cost us anything. But if they did, then attitudes toward them could change.
Welcome to Canada but I trust you will be paying for any security or other costs. You cannot benefit from your royal station.
No, we haven’t spent any time thinking about this issue,
We obviously are always looking to make sure, as a member of the Commonwealth, we play a role. We have not had any discussions on that subject at this time.
You’re among friends, and always welcome here,

articles.title: Rocket Launches, Trips to Mars and More 2020 Space and Astronomy Events
articles.author: By Michael Roston
articles.abstract: A year full of highs and lows in space just ended, and the 12 months to come will be full of new highlights in orbit and beyond.

articles.title: Japan’s Skateboarders Roll, Warily, Out of the Shadows
articles.author: By John Branch and Chang W. Lee
articles.abstract: A culture long seen as a disruptive and dangerous presence on Tokyo’s streets wonders if Olympic success this summer might finally bring everyday acceptance.

quotes.quote: Skateboarding became one of the sports at the Olympics, but the image of skateboarding in Japan is that it’s an activity for unruly kids,
I can’t skate over there,
That would bother people.
For my old friends, we want to show that what we did was not wrong,
For the newcomers, who come to skateboarding because of the Olympics, I explain that our culture is cool. We are why they are competing.
People gradually see skateboarding as a sport,
But most people will not understand that the counterculture side is the real skateboarding.
Here, no one uses skateboards for transportation — you can’t,
If you skate in the street, it means you’re from a bad place. It’s a bad image.
That’s the struggle of the skateboarder here,
People shout, ‘You should be doing that in the skateparks!’ And that’s a complete misunderstanding of skateboarding.
But it’s actually the opposite.

articles.title: Britons on Brexit: ‘We’ve Made a Spectacle of Ourselves’
articles.author: By Ceylan Yeginsu
articles.abstract: As Britain’s withdrawal from the European Union becomes a reality, some people are celebrating and others are mourning. But for most, it seems, it is a time for recuperation and healing.

quotes.quote: It’s just been day after day of dysfunction, division and economic uncertainty. I’m not sure how we are supposed to bounce back from this,
The irony is that Brexit was all about taking back control, but we’ve never been so out of control. No one even knows what the reality of Brexit will look like.
get Brexit done.
quotes.context: The atmosphere became so toxic that in December’s general election, many Britons crossed traditional political divides to deliver the Conservative government a substantial mandate to “get Brexit done.”

quotes.quote: Voting in the election was one of the hardest decisions of my life,
We’ve made a spectacle of ourselves squabbling over Brexit for years. We’ve let down vulnerable communities, whose needs have been neglected because the government was paralyzed by Brexit,
We had to move forward before the damage caused became irreparable.
This isn’t about racism or discrimination against foreigners,
We welcome different nationalities and cultures in England, but the number we have absorbed is out of control. There aren’t enough jobs, houses and services to accommodate these people.
I do worry about the divides that have arisen from Brexit, but I fear that we would have seen unrest if the Brexit decision had been reversed,
behind closed doors.
quotes.context: “We do the work they do not want to do, we live 10 people to one house, we earn our way of life and we do not burden anybody,” he said, adding that while he felt welcome in the town he was aware of hostile comments about the Polish community made “behind closed doors.”

quotes.quote: There’s more to this town, there’s more to this country
quotes.context: Boston residents were reluctant to talk about Brexit on a recent cold and rainy day — “There’s more to this town, there’s more to this country” one pensioner said.

quotes.quote: I am concerned about the people who carry the perspective that as long as issues of the country aren’t harming them personally, they can remain uninformed and uninvolved,

Events within politics have made me feel as the likelihood of cohesion within our country is out of the picture, and while our nation is ideally supposed to become more unified when faced with threats of division, the opposite has occurred.
As we’ve become more divided on the subject of immigration, racism and hate crimes have become normalized, and British society has become more closed-minded,
It’s very disturbing.
Most young people are really for Europe,
If we get a voting system that allows us to really vote for who we want then I can see a scenario where we are back in Europe in five to 10 years. It’s possible.

articles.title: The Olympics Want Tiger Woods. He Wants to Go. But There’s a Catch.
articles.author: By Karen Crouse
articles.abstract: Golf was restored to the Games, in part, to forge an association with stars like Woods. But with a few months left to qualify, he is on the outside looking in.

quotes.quote: The very first question asked was, ‘Will Tiger Woods play?’
quotes.context: “The very first question asked was, ‘Will Tiger Woods play?’”

quotes.quote: And especially at the age I’ll be, I don’t know if I have many more chances,
I know TV companies for obvious reasons are excited about it,
nothing that another Masters win wouldn’t cure.
quotes.context: But that is, as Dawson joked, “nothing that another Masters win wouldn’t cure.”

quotes.quote: There may be some of that,
I’m sure Tiger wouldn’t want to get into the Games that way.
a big goal,
quotes.context: After his victory last year at the Masters, he described the Olympics as “a big goal,” but he admitted “getting there and making the team is going to be the tough part.”
